DOC.brief_summary: Participants study randomize receive either oral vitamin D pills OR ultraviolet light treatment . The investigator compare two method raise vitamin D level affect cholesterol level .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Oral Vitamin D Versus Narrow-Band UV-B Exposure Lipid Profile
DOC.detailed_description: Potential subject screen eligibility , include serum 25 ( OH ) D level < 20ng/ml . Eligible subject randomly assign receive either : 1 ) oral vitamin D3 , 50,000 unit weekly 8 week 2 ) narrow-band UVB radiation , 2 treatments/wk 8 week . Duration treatment base skin type . After 8 week , 25 ( OH ) D level measure monthly . For participant level < 35 ng/ml , additional dos oral vitamin D3 UV radiation administer . A subset partcipants group participate skin biopsy cohort , skin biopsy obtain 8 week treatment .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age > 18 year 2 . Vitamin D 25OH level < 20 ng/ml 1 . Serum calcium > 10.5 mg/dl 2 . Serum phosphorus > 5.5 mg/dl 3 . Serum PTH level < 12 pg/ml 4 . LDL cholesterol > 190 mg/dl 5 . History recent acute infection ( within 1 month ) 6 . Glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) < 60 mL/min 7 . Liver Function test indicative liver disease ( AST ALT > 3x ULN ) 8 . Current use Vitamin D > 400 IU/day 9 . Current use statin , fibrates , niacin , ezetimibe 10 . Current use medication affect sensitivity UV light 11 . Pregnancy ( selfreported ) 12 . Intentional UV exposure ( e.g . tan bed use ) last 2 week plan use participate study 13. history malignancy remission ( > 6 month ) 14 . History malignant melanoma 15 . Participation investigational drug study within 30 day screen visit 16 . Any medical , psychological social condition , opinion Investigator , would jeopardize health wellbeing participant study procedure integrity data . 17 . History nonmelanoma skin cancer
